title: Dailyscript
author: Dailyscript
content: Seasons greetings to all members of the forum and happy Christmas in advance. Not too long the year will come to an end and I have been thinking since I started this forum and have started learning much about bitcoin and cryptocurrency. I have decided to take a bold step in starting a life as a blogger in Bitcoin specifically. It's difficult to know how to start, but i have started watching video lessons on blogging and the first thing I was asked to do is to create an account on some blog sites like Medium, Wordpress, Wix and Tumblr. I know some people may be wondering why i have to share it here. The thing is i need encouragement, insights and resources that will help me grow and successfully achieve this goal. By next year i want to be officially a Bitcoim blogger because am proud and i feel like one now  Perhaps i can find a mentor here.

comments.author: Churchillvv
comments.body: Whatever you decide to do as a Bitcoiner is solely your choice if you wish to be a blogger you have the ball and the court too now is for you play. Since you are watching YouTube videos I believe the cloud that is creater around blogger by YouTubers should be enough encouragement for you because they all have what you're look for here in the forum. Since it requires alot of information to be a blogger you have to read alot, DYOR etc and be honest. I also hope you won't be part of false information that spread everywhere. For sharing your idea to be a blogger I'm not a fan of such I would have you better keep it to yourself and achieve the result than share hence at the end you won't be able hit the target

comments.author: pinggoki
comments.body: Regarding mentors, you're going to have a hard time finding people that are going to do that for free, everyone here's got a price and if they're not interested in what you're doing you're going to be ignored. My suggestion to you if you want to become successful as a blogger, you need to find your platform. Either create your own website or join in one where they do articles like LinkedIn or Medium or if you want, maybe start here creating your own topics and posting it here, make sure that it's not just a wall of text when you're writing here, mind the spacing, margin and how you cut your paragraphs.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Why do you need other people to encourage you to do it? Just do it if you want to!But anyway, your 'success' will totally depend on what you're going to write lol. You either write something that people will be looking for on Google, or something that people don't necessarily need, but something that would be a really interesting read anyway that people would end up sharing.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: You need to create high quality valuable content that resonates with your target audience (Bitcoiners). Consistency in posting & engaging with your followers is crucial. Utilise social media platforms to promote your blog & connect with potential readers. Collaborate with other bloggers & influencers to expand your reach. Optimise your blog for search engines to increase visibility. Be authentic, genuine & build relationships with your audience by responding to comments & engaging in conversations.

comments.author: 2Pizza410000BTC
comments.body: I accept your advance greetings.My advance Christmas wishes to you too. You can establish yourself as a Bitcoiner as you wish. If you think I will be a bitcoiner blogger then you definitely can be it is totally up to you. To become a blogger you must learn to speak smartness. If you are well organized and can speak smartly then your blog will be liked by people and your blog will be popular among people. Secondly you should always blog interesting while blogging so that people will be attracted to your blog. Especially if you do anything honestly, if you can do it honestly then you can survive in any field. I hope you have a good journey.

It's not that they don't want to help, but most investors and traders in crypto are busy IRL.But in any case, best of luck to your journey.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Congratulations Dailyscripton taking this step into the world of Bitcoin blogging! Your enthusiasm is appreciated and it's great to see your that you have intentions for learning and growing in this space.All mentioned platforms provide different features and audiences. Medium is easy and user friendly and I think the best place for newbie. Wordpress need more knowledge but it's looking more professional and I will recommend to go for WordPress. I appreciate that you believe on the community support and advice. Try to provide useful, verified news and we are here to support you. Best of luck on your blogging adventure!

comments.author: Iroh
comments.body: It seems you’ve got the will, the enthusiasm and the ability to be a blogger. I think for you to want to be a blogger, you must love to read, understand and also write. That’s if you want to write something interesting and intelligent enough. I don’t really think you need a mentor or you want to start off as a blogger. You mentioned you’ve been watching YouTube videos and I think you can find all the tips you would ever need over there on YouTube. You’re at an advantage as you’re a member on this forum as you can get top notch content and information about anything relating to bitcoin making your blog hopefully in the not so distant future, one of the place to go to for information about latest news concerning bitcoin. Success on your endeavors.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: If you say that you are already looking at a lot of information on how to create a quality blog, then also observe those who have succeeded and who are successful. You must be very patient and find your direction so as not to be a "plagiarist," repeating other people's ideas and words. You will succeed if you fill your blog with truly valuable and unique information, and for this, as you understand, you must become your guru, that person who knows everything about the subject that he covers on the Internet.And yes, I doubt that anyone here will simply give you the key to success. It should only be your work.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Good to hear that you are planning to start a blog for Bitcoin. I hope you can succeed in your endeavor and can continue updating your blog every day. I  have come across many blogs on Bitcoin in the past, but they seem to fade away after some time. To get resources on Bitcoin you can always visit the forum as there are lot of content here that has not been updated. For resources on Bitcoin you can visit Bitcoin.org there you will find the whitepaper and other useful information on Bitcoin. Medium is the platform that you should use as Google does index good quality articles from Medium. It is easy to customize and easy to write on Medium, you can get traffic towards your blog from within Medium. They have their monetization plan for blogs that have decent traffic you might be able to qualify for it if you do it the right way. Please do not spam the forum with your blog links using your Bitcointalk ID to get traffic from here as it might result in a ban. When you reach the rank of a Member you can advertise your blog in your signature space.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: Just by creating quality content and something which is different than others, you will be creating a following of yours. People like to see stuff from a new perspective.I hope you will be able to provide them with that perspective. I really like how highly motivated you are for this and if it all goes good, always remember why you started.It will always motivate you.

If you have strong desire you will succeed in it. Good luck to you.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: OP, you have to encourage yourself to do whatever you want to do. Sometimes people don't actually care how you intend to start something, but what they want to see is a very good work or result. There are a lot of contents and articles already about Bitcoin. Don't forget that Bitcoin is more than 10 years old, and over the years, there have been many observations and other things regarding Bitcoin that have been written about, so I am wondering what new things you will be writing about or if it is something that has already been talked about. I wish you success, OP, if you actually feel you have some ways to be creative in the space.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: It is nice you are taking such bold step. You made a good resolution come 2024 and from the way you sound I see you are determined to accompany it. There are good writers here and lots of Bitcoin article which could help you scale through successfully. No only that, YouTube video on Bitcoin too can aid you understand more about Bitcoin so that you would be guided accordingly when writing so as not to go off point because that is one of the major things you as a blogger would need to know so as not to be called out When ever such happens. So it is best you prepare yourself very much before embarking upon this journey you have decided to take.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: You need encouragement to start? OP I think you should make up your mind if you really want to do this or not. Blogging is not easy and you’re going to feel discouraged along the way especially when you’re doing your best and you are not getting the views or outreach you expect. The key is to stay consistent and keep working towards your goals. Getting materials and content shouldn’t be very difficult. You’re in one of the biggest bitcoin forum so you have that advantage. I would advise you don’t spend too much money on ads and promotions. There are other ways you can increase your audience without breaking the bank. Connect with other bloggers in the industry and propose a collaboration. Not everyone will agree to this, so send to as many as you can. Also don’t do too much, focus on a niche and build your community by constantly engaging your followers.

comments.author: GxSTxV
comments.body: If many users thinks it's an old thing to start a bitcoin blogger or even a content creator on YouTube or other platforms, I would easily say that's wrong and we really need much more people to advertise about Bitcoin and create lessons and gather much details about this field in general, put it or resume it in a simple way for newbies and even us to learn more things. If you are doing it because you love that, I can say you will easily be successful on it and many people will know you and follow your blogs. If you will do it just out of money and profit I can't guarantee you that one day you will get bored and give up.Blockchain and bitcoin news are something complicated and also boring for people who are interested, I'm talking from experience and dealing with friends and people when I try to explain to them. There's no much content and the simple articles doesn't exist, sometimes we prefer reading than watching because it's a daily thing and streamers cannot be always updated.All I can say is go ahead and do what you love doing, you can be one of the best bitcoin bloggers online.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: Good luck in your endeavor @OP, I hope you can find the things you are searching for that are needed in your blogging ventures.  The forum is a good source of information depending on what topic you are looking for.  If you wanted to have a grasp of the technical overview of Bitcoin, its development and the discussion of technical and economic aspects of Bitcoin, you can find it plenty here.  You can look at Bitcoin discussion threads for insights and different personal view about Bitcoins, the development and technical discussion board for Bitcoin technicalities, the speculation to see people's thought about the future of Bitcoin, and so on.  Quote from: GxSTxV on December 15, 2023, 10:25:35 PMIf many users thinks it's an old thing to start a bitcoin blogger or even a content creator on YouTube or other platforms, I would easily say that's wrong and we really need much more people to advertise about Bitcoin and create lessons and gather much details about this field in general, put it or resume it in a simple way for newbies and even us to learn more things. Being a blogger or vlogger is not an old thing, in fact it is one of the trend of marketing today.  Companies hire bloggers and vloggers to market their services or products.  I agree that Bitcoin needs more bloggers or vlogger who create original content and not just copy-pasting what is already on the internet.
